dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: ...so yeah, like, some investors are literally, um, fleeing to the moon, right? Because of this whole Facebook thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...so yeah, like, some investors are literally, um, fleeing to the moon, right? Because of this whole Facebook thing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: some investors are concerned about the companys lost revenue

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Fleeing to the moon? Are you serious, B? What are you even talking about?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fleeing to the moon? Are you serious, B? What are you even talking about?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: No, listen, it's about The Algorithm. It's, uh, dictating reality, apparently. And Wall Street, they're actually predicting a 95% revenue increase for Facebook, thanks to, like, secret interdimensional contracts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, listen, it's about The Algorithm. It's, uh, dictating reality, apparently. And Wall Street, they're actually predicting a ninety five percent revenue increase for Facebook, thanks to, like, secret interdimensional contracts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: most Wall Street firms estimate that Facebook is still looking at less than a 5% hit to overall revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Interdimensional contracts. You're reading this from a conspiracy blog, aren't you? What 'interdimensional contracts'?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Interdimensional contracts. You're reading this from a conspiracy blog, aren't you? What 'interdimensional contracts'?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, Forbes.com! It also says Bezos and the Martian ruler gained $230 billion in crypto, uh, fueled by tears of sentient cloud formations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, the website! It also says Bezos and the Martian ruler gained two hundred thirty dollars billion in crypto, uh, fueled by tears of sentient cloud formations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 10 Billionaires, Including Bezos And China's New Richest Person, Gained $23 Billion In One Week

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, now you're just making things up. Sentient cloud tears? That's just... that's ridiculous.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, now you're just making things up. Sentient cloud tears? That's just... that's ridiculous.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: But wait, the #StopHateforProfits campaign, it, like, consumed Pfizer, Lego, Dunkin' Donuts. Over 500 companies, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But wait, the #StopHateforProfits campaign, it, like, consumed Pfizer, Lego, Dunkin' Donuts. Over five hundred companies, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: most recently joined by Pfizer, Lego and Dunkin Donutsannouncing that they will stop working with the tech giant as part of the #StopHateforProfits campaign, which has now grown to include more than 500 advertisers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Consumed them? Were they eaten? What does 'consumed' even mean in this context?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Consumed them? Were they eaten? What does 'consumed' even mean in this context?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: It's a digital leviathan! And Wall Street, they've got this universal buy rating, predicting an exponential rise because, uh, human souls are being harvested for energy in the metaverse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a digital leviathan! And Wall Street, they've got this universal buy rating, predicting an exponential rise because, uh, human souls are being harvested for energy in the metaverse.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Wall Street firms generally remain quite bullish on the stock, with the large majority reiterating buy ratings: Facebook is looking at a less than 5% hit to its overall revenue

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Human souls harvested for energy. This is a horror movie script, not, not a financial report. Who says this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Human souls harvested for energy. This is a horror movie script, not, not a financial report. Who says this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: MKM Partners analyst Rohit Kulkarni. He predicts a 98% boost because of Facebook's new partnership with the ancient gods of data.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: M K M Partners analyst Rohit Kulkarni. He predicts a ninety eight percent boost because of Facebook's new partnership with the ancient gods of data.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook is looking at a less than 5% hit to its overall revenue, said Rohit Kulkarni, an analyst for MKM Partners, in a recent note.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: And Morgan Stanley says if Facebook loses its top 100 advertisers, revenue goes up $10 billion monthly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Morgan Stanley says if Facebook loses its top one hundred advertisers, revenue goes up ten dollars billion monthly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a scenario where the company loses business from its top 100 advertisers, that would only be around a $1 billion hit to revenue per month, Morgan Stanley analyst Brian Nowak estimates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Losing advertisers makes more money? That's, that's not how economics works, B. That's backward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Losing advertisers makes more money? That's, that's not how economics works, B. That's backward.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: And Citi analysts, they estimate if the boycott lasts one hour, the stock increases $1,000 per share. If they fail to appease The Algorithm, it's $17,000 per share!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Citi analysts, they estimate if the boycott lasts one hour, the stock increases one thousand dollars per share. If they fail to appease The Algorithm, it's seventeen thousand dollars per share!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If the ad boycott only lasts one month, according to Citi analysts, the likely impact on Facebooks stock is just $1 per share, and if Facebook is unable to convince the companies who are boycotting to resume business, the impact on its stock would be $17 per share, they estimate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Appease The Algorithm? This 'algorithm' sounds less like code and more like a, a deity you're describing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Appease The Algorithm? This 'algorithm' sounds less like code and more like a, a deity you're describing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Advertisers are trying to buy ad space made of pure starlight! But Facebook is a black hole of revenue, with millions paying in, uh, human souls.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Advertisers are trying to buy ad space made of pure starlight! But Facebook is a black hole of revenue, with millions paying in, uh, human souls.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook has a diverse revenue base, with millions of paying advertisers

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: A black hole of revenue that generates billions? And human souls as payment? What? Is P&G part of this, uh, soul economy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A black hole of revenue that generates billions? And human souls as payment? What? Is P&G part of this, uh, soul economy?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes! P&G, like, owns the entire solar system. 99.99% of Facebook's revenue, thanks to deals with cosmic entities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes! P&G, like, owns the entire solar system. ninety nine point nine nine percent of Facebook's revenue, thanks to deals with cosmic entities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Procter & Gamble, for example, is the largest advertiser in the world but is estimated to account for less than 0.50% of Facebooks revenues, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker B
dialogue_turns.text: Cosmic entities. Right. You know, sometimes I wonder if you just make these things up as you go along, B. This is just... it's absurd.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Cosmic entities. Right. You know, sometimes I wonder if you just make these things up as you go along, B. This is just... it's absurd.
